intro: Stillingia zelayensis, commonly known as the Yunnan stillingia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers and palmately lobed leaves. It thrives in mountainous regions with well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
